page.title: 05 BEAUCHIEF ABBEY(cont)
page.content:
During the 100 years following Henry's seizure, the Abbey was allowed to fall into ruin.In{1648}it passed by marriage to the{Pegge}family. The Abbey stayed with this family until{ {1923}when the then High Sheriff of Nottingham disposed of it to{Frank {Crawshaw}in{1923.}
Today the Abbey with its tower only two-thirds its original height presents an interesting relic of less secular times. Outside,on the north and south sides are contrasting doorways,rounded Norman,pointed Gothic,salvage from the ruins.Graves of owning families lie beside the still traceable foundations of the original buildings.
